#Text=You want to be sure to be prepared and do it no sooner than an hour  after sunset time . "

column1: #Text=Listen to your local radio station or TV , or find the information in your newspaper .
#Text=If you want very accurate information , a World Clock Time Zone website will help so you can easily find the correct time .
#Text=Here 's a link to the WorldClockTimeServer website out of the many accurate time servers that exist .
#Text=Check your local time against the World Clock to ensure your watch is set right so you can watch the star .
#Text=Find out what time the sun sets in your area .
#Text=Check this website to find your local sunset and sundown times .

#Text=Please note that these are only two websites out of the very many in CyberSpace that you can use to get the same information , but for the purposes of this article , it should only be limited to one for the correct time and one to find the sunset and sunrise information .
#Text=Go outside and look up , while panning your eyes across the top of the horizon .
#Text=Can you physically see clouds or does it look gray or white ?

#Text=If so , this is not a good night to see or watch the stars without a strong telescope that can peer out past the clouds , such as the Hubble Telescope because the weather is too cloudy if it 's not crystal clear .
#Text=There are other space telescopes besides Hubble , but it 's the most talked about space telescope at this time .
#Text=Can you see stars twinkling in the beautiful night sky ?
#Text=Wait until it 's a really clear night then go outside and find a dark place to view the sky .
#Text=It could be your backyard , a park , or even just a quiet place in your mind .
#Text=Tilt your head straight up and stop .
#Text=Close your eyes and count to 10 very slowly .
#Text=Open your eyes very slowly and gaze into the universe .
#Text=Do n't you wonder how it got there ?
#Text=Look at all the constellations and far away stars and planets .
#Text=Yes , some planets and stars are so far away that you ca n't even see them .
#Text=The ones you cannot yet see are the falling stars .
#Text=If it 's a night and you 're in a city , you may need to go to the rooftop of the building so you can get above the lights of the city .
#Text=If you know the song " When You Wish Upon a Star , " try singing it while you watch and have fun .
#Text=Everyone knows that in all practicality you really ca n't possibly catch a falling star literally , so do n't try to do that !
#Text=If you 're going to a rooftop building , stay away from the edge .
#Text=Use a chair to sit down and lean back .
#Text=It helps you relax and enjoy the view more .
#Text=A dark comfortable place to watch stars
